articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Kim Pyong Hun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Kim Pyong Hun
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un on Wednesday sent a wreath to the bier of late Kim Pyong Hun, winner of Order of Kim Il Sung, Kim Il Sung Prize winner, labor hero and former chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: NDC Policy Department Warns U.S., S. Korea against Anti-DPRK Acts
articles.content:
NDC Policy Department Warns U.S., S. Korea against Anti-DPRK Acts
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Policy Department of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK issued the following statement Thursday:
					 Years of tensions and confrontation have been defused and atmosphere for reconciliation and cooperation has been created in the direction of achieving peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula in recent days thanks to the initiative measures taken by the DPRK.
					
					 Typical examples are the sincere efforts made by it to save the Kaesong Industrial Zone from the danger of total shutdown and bring the operations in the zone to normal and to solve from a broad stand such issues as the reunions of families and relatives separated from the last Korean War and resumption of the Mt. Kumgang tourism project. The separation is symbolic of tragic national division.
					
					 It is the fixed stand and will of the army and people of the DPRK to realize at any cost whatever is required by the times and desired by the fellow countrymen.
					
					 These are prompted by the firm policy to perfectly carry forward the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration for its implementation, precious fruitions of the devotions and painstaking efforts made by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and heritages bequeathed down by him out of his patriotic will for reunification, and thus pave the wide avenue for national reunification and peace and prosperity.
					
					 Unfortunately, however, the atmosphere for reconciliation hardly in the making has faced a serious challenge from the beginning due to the improper attitude taken by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities who are still seized by the old confrontational concept.
					
					 The present chief executives of the U.S. and south Korea are loudly speaking about ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and building reconciliation and confidence between the north and the south. But in fact, they directly choreographed dangerous war racket and confrontation moves, quite contrary to their call. This is a stark reality today.
					
					 They started on August 19 the DPRK-targeted Ulji Freedom Guardian war exercises as before under the pretext of "annual" exercises. In mid-August they started the operation of scattering leaflets slandering the DPRK with the use of human scum. 
					
					 We can not but question if it is the U.S.-style way of "improving ties" and south Korean-style way of "building confidence" to level guns at the dialogue partner and to respond to the magnanimous and peaceful step with war drills and sinister psychological warfare.
					
					 It is well known by the world that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities cried out for the DPRK's "dismantlement of nuclear weapons" more loudly than any others.
					
					 During the recent war exercises they flied formations and flying corps of B-52H nuclear strategic bombers from Guam and the U.S. mainland to the sky above the Korean Peninsula round the clock, openly posing nuclear threat to the DPRK. 
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, it should stop the nuclear blackmail against the DPRK. The present rulers of south Korea should drop the double-dealing attitude of tolerating outsider's nuke while denying the nation's nuke.
					
					 It is important for the south Korean authorities to stop vitriolic rhetoric against the DPRK and clear themselves of discord, antagonism, distrust and hostility, to begin with, if they do not want to see the north-south ties repeating the bitter history of the past five years.
					
					 The present rulers of south Korea, without deep knowledge about war and military affairs, are taking the lead in inciting confrontation and escalating tensions while touring what they called wartime commanding posts and field command posts, being lost to reason. They will only face shameless fate, being marginalized by the public.
					
					 They are calling a small agreement that was reached with much difficulty a "victory of principle" and making a mockery of the public, being guided by its own unilateral yardstick called "common sense and international norms". This will only cast shadow to hard-won atmosphere for dialogue.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will neither give up nor make even a step backward in the road for ensuring peace and security of the country and building a powerful and prosperous country.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK equipped with powerful striking means have followed with vigilance not only the whole process of the war exercises but all the movements of the flying corps of nuclear strategic bombers, with their guns aimed at them, being considerate of the nation's desire and wishes.
					
					 We are seriously examining issues for planning and realizing several constructive and bold peaceful measures while still exercising utmost patience for genuine peace and detente on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Time has come to drop for good the hostile concept and the policy for confrontation with the fellow countrymen, leftovers of the Cold War era.
					
					 Now is the time to stop anachronistic act of targeting the dialogue partner and take political decisions favorable for creating atmosphere for dialogue and peaceful environment.
					
					 This is the demand of the times and the people.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should clearly face up to the trend of the times and think twice.
					
					 They should remember that there is limit to the magnanimity and patience of the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will closely follow with high vigilance every movement of the present chief executives of the U.S. and south Korea.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea War Exercises Slammed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea War Exercises Slammed
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The National Peace Committee of Korea spokesman issued the following statement Thursday:
					 Recently the situation on the Korean Peninsula has turned to the road of detente from that of confrontation. This was thanks to the initiative measures taken by the DPRK for the improvement of the north-south ties and the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the sincere efforts made by it for them.
					
					 But the trend for reconciliation and unity has faced a serious challenge due to the reckless nuclear war moves and confrontational racket against the DPRK being kicked up by the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers.
					
					 On August 27, the U.S. imperialist aggressors flew two B-52H nuclear strategic bombers to the sky above south Korea from an air force base in the U.S. mainland to stage a nuclear attack drill targeting the DPRK before their deployment on Guam. 
					
					 At night on August 15 and during the day on August 21, a few days after they started Ulji Freedom Guardian, they flew Guam-based B-52H to the sky above Jik Islet in south Korea, two planes each, staging DPRK-targeted nuclear strike drills.
					
					 The U.S. introduction of the nuclear strategic bombers, one of three nuclear strategic strike means, timed to coincide with the massive Ulji Freedom Guardian which it is staging together with the puppet south Korean warmongers with the involvement of its huge troops, is an open nuclear threat to the DPRK, a revelation of its hideous scheme to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost and another unpardonable grave provocation.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers kicked up the racket for confrontation with the DPRK, saying that when a war breaks out they have to surely win and full combat readiness should be taken, openly throwing a hurdle in the way for hardly arranged north-south dialogue.
					
					 This is an intolerable mockery of the DPRK, which is making big efforts while exercising patience for detente, and an anachronistic act of going against the aspiration of the Koreans for the improvement of the north-south ties and stability and against the trend of the times. 
					
					 Question is if they have face to talk about "dialogue", "genuine peace" and "stability" while being bent on war moves against the DPRK with the use of nuclear strategic bombers, the dialogue partner.
					
					 Moreover, it is the height of folly and brigandish sophism to cry out for "dismantlement of nuclear program" by the DPRK while posing a nuclear threat to it.
					
					 The situation clearly proves that it is exactly the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers who are straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula and escalating confrontation.
					
					 There is a limit to the patience of the DPRK as it had already clarified.
					
					 Peace, stability and advancement of the north-south ties can never be realized with the efforts by one side only.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean military warmongers should know that dangerous provocations violating sovereignty of the DPRK and encroaching upon its supreme interests will lead to an irrevocable development.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean warmongers should behave with discretion, not misjudging the patience and self-restraint exercised by the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: WHO Representative Presents Credentials to Pak Ui Chun
articles.content:
WHO Representative Presents Credentials to Pak Ui Chun
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun received credentials from Stephan Paul Jost, representative of the World Health Organization here, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Pak had a talk with the representative after receiving credentials.

articles.title: Congratulations to FM of Iran
articles.content:
Congratulations to FM of Iran
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Mohammad Javad Zarif upon his appointment as foreign minister of Iran.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries steadily developing on good terms even under the complicated international situation would invariably grow in the future, too, wishing him success in his new job.

articles.title: National Day of Vietnam Marked
articles.content:
National Day of Vietnam Marked
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba gave a reception at Okryu Restaurant Thursday to mark the 68th anniversary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					  Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice Department Director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea Pak Kun Gwang, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon, Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Myong San, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Kim Jin Bom who is chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Vietnamese embassy were on hand.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special envoy of the Chinese government for the issue of the Korean Peninsula and his party and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They made bows in humble reverence to the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the Generalissimos received are on display, the mourning hall and the halls which house cars, an electric car, boat and train coaches they used during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The guests made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group Passes through Kaesong
articles.content:
New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group Passes through Kaesong 
 Kaesong, August 29 (KCNA) -- The New Zealand motorcyclists' group touring from Mt. Paektu to Mt. Halla passed through Kaesong to enter south Korea after leaving the top of Mt. Paektu. 
					 A send-off ceremony took place at Panmunjom on Thursday. 
					
					 Present at the event were Pak Kyong Il, chairman of the DPRK-New Zealand Friendship Association, officials concerned, citizens of Kaesong and members of the group. 
					
					 Gareth Morgan, head of the group, said the purpose of its tour is to show the world that Korea with a long history is a land with one and the same mountain range stretching from Mt. Paektu to Mt. Halla. 
					
					 He said that while staying in the DPRK he was deeply impressed to see the beautiful landscape of Korea and its people striving hard to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 At the end of the event, the members of the group started amid warm send-off of the crowd. 
					
					 Before starting the members of the group watched the monument to President Kim Il Sung's signature at Panmunjom. 
					
					 They also visited the conference room of armistice talks, the hall where the armistice agreement was signed and Panmun Pavilion, being briefed on the fact that the army and people of the DPRK beat back the invasion of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and achieved a shining victory. 
					
					 The group crossed the Military Demarcation Line that day.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a congratulatory message from Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, national leader of the Workers' Party of Mexico, on August 22.
					 The message said:
					
					 Respected Comrade First Secretary
					
					 I have the honor of extending warmest congratulations and fraternal salute to you on behalf of all members of the Workers' Party of Mexico and on my own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK, September 9.
					
					 The great Comrade Kim Il Sung is the eternal President of the DPRK, founder of socialist Korea and tender-hearted father of the Korean nation who devoted his whole life to the prosperity, wellbeing and happiness of the Korean people, and the great Comrade Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the WPK, outstanding thinker and theoretician and statesman who triumphantly led the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle to turn the DPRK into a socialist state of Juche with single-minded unity and invincible military capability.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish you good health for the steady prosperity of the DPRK and a final victory of the world socialist cause, expressing belief that the feats the great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in the nation-building would continue shining thanks to your wise Songun revolutionary leadership.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Encourages DPRK People in Building Sports Power
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Encourages DPRK People in Building Sports Power
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The finals of men's premier soccer league for Torch Cup took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium here on August 28, the Youth Day, in the presence of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Watching the match were servicepersons and youth and students in the city of Pyongyang. All those present at the stadium gave enthusiastic cheers to the supreme leader, who is working heart and soul for the nation's soccer development.
					
					 Nam Sun Il, an officer of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA: 
					
					 "Though busy with state affairs, Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un watched the match together with us.
					
					 I was moved by his high intention and devoted service for the nation's sports development. I will never forget this happy day all my life." 
					
					 Choe Yong Gwang, another KPA officer, said:
					
					 "The match was impressive to me.
					
					　But what deeply impressed me during it was the smiling face of Marshal Kim Jong Un, who gave great courage and strength to the players."
					
					 Kim Un Hyok, an official of the youth league organization of Kim Chaek University of Technology, said:
					
					 "As the match was over, Kim Jong Un invited the successful players and coaches to come up to the tribune and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 This touching scene made us, the youths, harden our will to take the lead in arousing sports enthusiasm throughout the country with his deep trust cherished deep in mind. 
					
					 I am sure that our country will emerge a sports power under his guidance."

articles.title: National Workers Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
National Workers Sports Contest Closes
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The national sports contest of workers closed. It started to mark the 53rd Day of Songun.
					 The participants proved successful at the contest by displaying sports technique, staunch fighting spirit and collectivist spirit.
					
					 Pyongyang City came first in team standings.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place at the Central Hall of Workers on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, those of the trade unions and players.
					
					 Team standings and standings in various events were announced at the ceremony. Then units and players who proved successful at the contest were awarded citations, trophy cups and medals.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions, in his closing address said that displayed at the contest were the concerted efforts and optimism of the heroic Korean workers who are stepping up the building of a thriving nation at the "speed on Masik Pass" under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He called upon all the officials and other workers to positively contribute to building an economic power and improving the standard of people's living with strong physical bodies through brisk mass sports activities.

articles.title: National Exhibition of Achievements of Young Scientists and Technicians Held
articles.content:
National Exhibition of Achievements of Young Scientists and Technicians Held 
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The national exhibition of achievements made by young scientists and technicians closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House Thursday. It was opened on Aug. 23 in celebration of the Youth Day. 
					 On display at the exhibition were more than 3 000 valuable inventions and new technical proposals including over 520 IT products which were developed by organizations of the youth league and young people across the country through their dynamic drive to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology under the uplifted banner of the industrial revolution in the new century.
					
					 During the exhibition the participants introduced valuable scientific and technical achievements and exchanged experience gained in the efforts to apply them into production. 
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were officials concerned and young scientists and technicians from across the country. 
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a closing address. 
					
					 Results of the general examination were announced there. 
					
					 Pyongyang City and the State Academy of Sciences took the special place. 
					
					 South Phyongan Province, the Academy of Medical Science, Jong Kwang Myong, researcher of Kim Il Sung University, Yun Kwang Hun, post-graduate student of Korea University of Physical Education, and Mun Pyol, teacher of Phyongsong University of Education, took the first place.
					
					 Those participants that won high appreciations were awarded citations, certificates of invention and certificates of rationalization proposals.

articles.title: Methanol Production Process Built at Hungnam Fertilizer Complex
articles.content:
Methanol Production Process Built at Hungnam Fertilizer Complex
 Hungnam, August 29 (KCNA) -- The methanol production process was newly built at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex. 
					 Workers of the complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex, the Equipment Assembly Complex, etc. overhauled two compressors and successfully manufactured and assembled equipment for the process.
					
					 Designers of the Hamhung Chemistry Designing Institute designed the methanol compounding tower in Korean style, saving a lot of materials and electricity. Scientists of the Hamhung Branch of the State Academy of Sciences successfully solved scientific and technical problems arising in the construction of the process. 
					
					 It is another foundation for keeping the vinalon production going at a high rate and bringing about a turn in developing light industry and improving people's living standard. 
					
					 A ceremony of its completion took place at the complex Thursday. 
					
					 Present there were Pak Pong Ju, Kwak Pom Gi and officials of the relevant fields and units, officials and employees of the complex and builders and helpers. 
					
					 A letter of thanks of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee to the builders of the methanol production process and their helpers was read out at the ceremony. 
					
					 The letter highly praised all the builders and helpers for successfully building another monumental structure in the era of Songun by displaying patriotic devotion, true to the behests of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the methanol production process.

articles.title: 3-D Underground Information Software Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
3-D Underground Information Software Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Environmental Engineering Institute under the State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK recently developed a new kind of three-dimensional underground information software.
					 The software makes it possible to figure the dynamic changes of pits and ore bodies in a three dimensional way in collieries and mines. Simulated exploitation is also available with the software.
					
					 It can display ore bodies and topography in model and diagram, increasing the speed of drawing mining areas tens of times faster than before.
					
					 The software has been applied to coal mines, including the Chonsong Youth Coal Mine under the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, helping boost coal output.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving National Reconciliation, Unity
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving National Reconciliation, Unity
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- It is a unanimous desire of all the Koreans and the demand of the era to achieve the national reconciliation and unity, says Rodong Sinmun in an article on Thursday.
					 The Koreans have suffered the bitter tragedy of national partition forced by outsiders for over six decades.
					
					 This resulted in the barrier of distrust caused by the differing ideas and social systems existing in the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 The longer the partition continues and the more serious the confrontation and distrust become, the taller it stands.
					
					 The inter-Korean ties plunged into deadlock in recent years with confrontation and tensions running high. This situation presents the national reconciliation and unity as a vital task in solving the issue of national reunification.
					
					 There is no reason whatsoever for compatriots in the north and the south of Korea not to get reconciled and united.
					
					 There are differences between the ideas and the social systems in the north and the south of Korea, but the Koreans can certainly get reconciled and united on the basis of the homogeneity of the nation that was formed in the course of creating culture and history for a long time, and the ever-growing aspiration for reunification.
					
					 Obstacles still lay ahead in achieving national reconciliation and unity and warming the inter-Korean ties.
					
					 A great many barriers may stand in the road to national reunification, but no one can dampen the will of all the Koreans to achieve the independent national reunification, and the final victory belongs to the united Korean nation.
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and overseas should turn out as one in the patriotic struggle for achieving independent reunification, peace and prosperity full of confidence in sure victory.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK-Cuba Friendship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK-Cuba Friendship 
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday dedicates an article to the 53rd anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Cuba.
					 The establishment of the bilateral diplomatic ties marked a turn in developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in all fields, and offered an occasion in dealing a deadly blow at the imperialists' vicious moves to blockade Cuba, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean people are pleased to have the true friends like the Cuban people.
					
					 The durability and invincibility of the friendship between the DPRK and Cuba were firmly consolidated by President Kim Il Sung and Fidel Castro, leader of the Cuban revolution.
					
					 The friendship and unity between the DPRK and Cuba are based on the strong will to keep to the path of socialism.
					
					 Today the Cuban people are registering big successes in their efforts to smash the imperialists' vicious moves to pressure Cuba, and defend the country, revolution and gains of socialism under the leadership of Raul Castro, president of the Council of State of Cuba.
					
					 The Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over all the successes achieved by the Cuban people and will send invariable support and solidarity to their just struggle in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK's People Greatly Inspired by Kim Jong Un's Work
articles.content:
DPRK's People Greatly Inspired by Kim Jong Un's Work
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, made public a talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" on August 25, the Day of Songun. 
					 In the talk, he expounded in a systematic and overall way the originality and great vitality of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il's theory on the Songun (military-first) revolution, the Songun politics, and the greatness of his Songun leadership exploits.
					
					 In this regard, Hong Chol, an officer of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, told KCNA:
					
					 The work has touched off my profound reverence for Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un, who provided a milestone worthy to be recorded in the history of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The Songun revolutionary idea of General Secretary Kim Jong Il serves as a treasure our army and people should maintain for all ages.
					
					 The work is a highly important programme for the Songun revolution as it shows the way for the Korean People's Army to invariably adhere to its character as the army of the leader and the party and always demonstrate its might as the pillar and driving force of the revolution.
					
					 All the servicepersons of my unit will resolutely defend the party and the leader whatever situation may come.
					
					 Ri Song Chol, a department director of the Ministry of Light Industry, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un's talk instills ardent patriotism into the hearts of people striving to build an economic giant in the spirit of creating the "Masikryong Speed".
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership, the light industry's modernization reached a higher level and its solid material foundations were fully provided.
					
					 Under such conditions, the future success in the industrial field depends entirely on officials' forward-looking insight and their devoted efforts.
					
					 We will make the light industrial factories operate at full capacity, thus bringing about a fresh turn in the production of consumer goods.

articles.title: World's Cultural Heritages in Kaesong City of DPRK (6)
articles.content:
World's Cultural Heritages in Kaesong City of DPRK (6)
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- There is the Seven Tombs Cluster at the foot of Mt. Mansu in Haeson-ri, Kaesong City of the DPRK, which was listed as world's cultural heritage.
					 The tombs are believed to be ones of those related to the royal family in the late period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) for their sizes, structures and remains.
					
					 The round-shaped cluster was built on a slope of the mountain.
					
					 Each of the tombs has stone pieces piled up in its lower part, with stone parapets and stone-made animal sculptures set up around it. The tombs are situated from the west to the east.
					
					 The Myongrung Cluster consisting of three tombs is located at the foot of a mountain about one kilometer west of the Mausoleum of King Wang Kon.
					
					 One of the three tombs was found to be Chung Mok's, the 29th king (1345-1348) of Koryo Kingdom.
					
					 The one-chamber tombs have flat ceilings with stars pictured on them. Their walls were built with plain rocks decorated with paintings.

articles.title: Candlelight Actions Expand in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Actions Expand in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean people are launching anti-"government" candlelight actions across south Korea in denunciation of the Intelligence Service's illegal interference in election.
					 South Koreans of all social strata took to the streets and accused the IS of rigging the "presidential election" in violation of democracy, terming it a political coup worse than the March 15 fraud-marred election by Syngman Rhee.
					
					 The network for overseeing the public security institutions made up of the Bar Association for Democratic Society, the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society and other civic and public organizations and human rights organizations issued a statement on June 12. They said it was violation of law and a challenge to the desire of the south Korean people for democracy that the conservative forces drew even power bodies into the "presidential election".
					
					 An organization in a candlelight rally before Posin Pavilion in Seoul on June 15 declared the election null and void, saying it was engineered by the IS and public security forces. 
					
					 The Youth Solidarity made public a declaration on the situation on June 20 which accused the authorities of rigging the election in an organized manner through the psychology and intelligence bureau at the instructions of Won Se Hun, former director of the IS.
					
					 More than 100,000 people signed their names, demanding state investigation into the case of the IS's interference in election, it said, adding this has touched off strong public resentment.
					
					 The Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS Interference in Presidential Election for Political Operation which consists of 200 plus civic and social organizations sponsored a candlelight rally in Jongro District, Seoul on June 28.
					
					 The organization held huge candlelight rallies at Seoul Square where more than 23,000 converged on July 13 and over 40,000 on Aug. 17 to demand the immediate dismissal of the present director of the IS and the immediate state investigation into the IS.
					
					 It warned that it would continue the candlelight actions if the authorities decline this.
					
					 The candlelight actions expanded to the scale of 100,000 in ten cities of south Korea including Pusan, Kwangju, Taegu, Taejon and Ulsan.

articles.title: Criminals Should Be Punished: S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Criminals Should Be Punished: S. Korean Organization
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on August 26 released a commentary calling for certainly probing the truth about the case of the Intelligence Service's interference in the election by concerted efforts, and punishing those involved in the case.
					 Candlelight actions are going on demanding a probe into the truth behind the case, the commentary said, and went on: But the truth about the case has not been probed through state investigation due to the persistent obstructions by the "Saenuri Party".
					
					 The probe should not be halted though, it noted, calling for punishing in the name of the people not only backstage forces but criminals Won Se Hun and Kim Yong Phan.
					
					 It also urged to investigate the illegal interference in the election by the "government", the "Saenuri Party", IS, prosecution and police, insisting on arresting and punishing all the criminals involved in the political operations.
					
					 The commentary called upon the progressive forces to fight for democracy through dynamic candlelight actions together with the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Intelligence Service's Interference in Election under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Intelligence Service's Interference in Election under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Jeju Parish of Catholics of south Korea held a press conference in Jeju Province on August 27 and published a declaration on the situation denouncing the case of the Intelligence Service's interference in the election.
					 The declaration said the case revealed injustice and illegality of power.
					
					 All believers of the parish together with all other people cannot but consider the case of the IS's interference in the election as frightful, it noted, and continued:
					
					 It has been confirmed in the course of the prosecution's investigation that the IS illegally interfered in the "presidential" election and the Seoul District Police Agency made public false results of investigation in a bid to gloss over the case.
					
					 It called for probing the truth about the case and punishing the prime movers and demanded an apology to the people, reform of the IS, etc.

articles.title: S. Korean Intelligence Service and Police's Repressive Racket against Opposition Parties
articles.content:
S. Korean Intelligence Service and Police's Repressive Racket against Opposition Parties
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Intelligence Service (IS) and the prosecution  of south Korea kicked up a wholesale campaign of suppression against the opposition Unified Progressive Party, according to CBS, KBS and MBC of south Korea.
					 On Wednesday the IS and the Suwon District Prosecutor's Office staged a frantic search operation against houses and offices of  a lawmaker from the party and those concerned and members of the eastern  association of Kyonggi Province on charges of plotting a rebellion.  Moreover, they arrested the vice-chairman of the Kyonggi Provincial Committee of the party and two more officials. 
					
					 The puppet group claimed it learned that they held a meeting in Seoul in May last and discussed a plan to topple the social system. It declared that it would search and investigate all those involved after branding their activities as the case of an underground revolutionary organization.
					
					 In this connection, the Unified Progressive Party charged that the authorities' crackdown upon the party under an absurd charge is little short of declaration of the "yusin" dictatorial system. 
					
					 The authorities are brandishing rusty swords called coloring operation and suppression under the pretext of security as the truth about the Intelligence Service's interference in the election is being brought to light, the party noted, warning the authorities are seriously mistaken if they calculate they can gag the people with bayonets as the dictators did in the past.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Telling Lies
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Telling Lies
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- An article accusing the south Korean puppet chief executive of evading the blame for the case of the Intelligence Service's interference in the election was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on August 27.
					 The article recalled that the chief executive repeatedly asserted at the meeting of senior secretaries of Chongwadae on August 26 that she did not receive any help from the IS during the "presidential" election. 
					
					 Her attitude of denying even the hard fact and repeating lies is as foolish as an act of covering the sky with her palms, it charged.
					
					 It has been recently brought into bolder relief that during the election the IS branded whoever opposed the candidate from the ruling party as "forces following the north", opened to public even the minutes of the south-north summit and helped the present chief executive attack the candidates from the opposition parties, it said.
					
					 The remarks made by her are answers to the people demanding the probe into the truth, punishment of those involved and prevention of the recurrence of the case, it held.
					
					 Denying even the fully disclosed fact is a concealment of the truth and an act of shutting eyes to the crimes and means that she cannot give assurances against the recurrence of the case, it noted.
					
					 Her lies amount to a declaration of war that she will challenge the people's mindset as they are surpassing Lee Myung Bak, the pronoun of intransigence and self-righteousness, it held.
					
					 The facts omen the miserable end of the present "government", it warned.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised in South Africa
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised in South Africa 
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism released a bulletin on Aug. 21 to mark the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Korea's liberator Kim Il Sung" said as follows:
					
					 The Korean people suffered immeasurable pain under the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists for a long time. Millions of innocent people were killed and hundreds of thousands of Korean women were forced to serve as sexual slaves. 
					
					 Korea had its rich underground resources exploited, Koreans were forced to change their names into Japanese ones and the country was at the risk of disappearing on the world map. 
					
					 The great leader of the Korean people Kim Il Sung embarked upon the road of the revolution in his teens with the high aim for independence of Korea. 
					
					 He formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union in 1926 and made public famous work "The Path of the Korean Revolution" in 1930.
					
					 He led the hard-fought struggle against the gangster-like Japanese imperialists for 15 years to liberate the country on August 15, 1945. He saved the country and people. 
					
					 His exploits of liberating Korea from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists are a great example to shine forever in the world history of the national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Russian Magazine Marks DPRK's 65th Birthday
articles.content:
Russian Magazine Marks DPRK's 65th Birthday
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Russian magazine Forum No. 90 carried 32-page special write-ups to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 It carried photos showing the exploits performed by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Together with photos dealing with the might and true pictures of Songun Korea, it carried at least 10 articles. 
					
					 The magazine said that Kim Il Sung led to the great victory the Fatherland Liberation War including the combat for liberating Taejon with his outstanding strategy and tactics and unique war methods. 
					
					 It praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power. It said that the service personnel and people of the DPRK are working miracles in the efforts for defending socialism and building an economic power under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It introduced the exploits of Kim Jong Il who provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, a landmark for national reunification, and said that the world praises Kim Jong Un as the most famous leader. 
					
					 In articles titled "How was the Korean War provoked?" and "Why did the U.S. ignite the Korean War?" the magazine disclosed the aggressive aim sought by the U.S. about six decades ago to stifle the DPRK in its bud and realize its wild ambition for world domination. 
					
					 Other articles disclosed the fact that the U.S. imperialists have committed nuclear threats and moves for aggression against the DPRK for more than half a century.

articles.title: Romanian Figure Marks DPRK's Day of Songun
articles.content:
Romanian Figure Marks DPRK's Day of Songun
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, on Aug. 22 posted on its internet website an article titled "Songun revolutionary leadership of H.E. General Secretary Kim Jong Il: Korean People's Army (KPA) is a strong fortress for victory in the revolution" to mark the 53rd Day of Songun in the DPRK. 
					 He said as follows:
					
					 Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the KPA on Aug. 25, 1960. 
					
					 This marked the start of the Songun leadership by Kim Jong Il, great successor to the revolutionary cause of H.E. Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il defined the KPA as the main force of the revolution and firmly established the Workers' Party of Korea's leadership over the KPA. He worked his heart and soul so that the people's army had politico-ideological, material and technical foundation to fight the modern war. 
					
					 In fact, the immortal exploits he performed in strengthening the KPA, will shine long in the history of Korea.
					
					 The Songun revolutionary leadership started and developed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is now successfully carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un. Thank to the Songun revolutionary leadership, the KPA has further developed into invincible revolutionary armed forces reliably defending peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The Korean people and socialist Korea will always win victory under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland jointly made public a statement on August 20 to mark the 53rd Day of Songun, when General Secretary Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					 The statement said as follows:
					
					 On August 25, the Korean people will greet the 53rd significant anniversary when Generalissimo Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 This day is a historic day of the Songun revolution for socialist Korea. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il inspected Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on Aug. 25, 1960. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il, peerless Songun commander, started the Songun revolutionary leadership for strengthening the military power of the country by inheriting the intention of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 Progressives and anti-imperialist fighters of the world highly praise Kim Jong Il, who is identical to Kim Il Sung, as invincible and iron-willed commander. 
					
					 With the Songun revolutionary leadership Kim Jong Il made the DPRK a world-level politico-ideological and military power. 
					
					 Under his leadership the Korean People's Army resolutely shattered all the war moves on the part of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces in the 1990s. 
					
					 After the demise of Kim Jong Il the Korean people upheld Marshal Kim Jong Un as supreme leader of the party, state and army. 
					
					 We believe that under the Songun politics of Kim Jong Un the DPRK, invincible fortress of socialism, will fully demonstrate its might.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked in Guinea
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked in Guinea
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a special bulletin on Aug. 22 on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The bulletin in its article titled "Immortal Songun exploits" said that Aug. 25, 1960 marked Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. It went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il ushered in the new era of prosperity unprecedented in the Korean history spanning 5 000 years with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He put the country's military power on the highest stage and turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power and ushered in the new golden days of building a thriving nation.
					
					 His Songun revolutionary leadership is being steadily carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The bulletin in another article titled "August 25 of Songun" noted that Kim Jong Il formulated Songun politics as a political mode under socialism.
					
					 It stressed that the DPRK has dynamically advanced along the road of prosperity, standing firm against the U.S., adding that such miraculous reality is the brilliant fruition of Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Nigeria
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian preparatory committee to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK was inaugurated in Abuja on Aug. 23.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who is member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and organize colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the anniversary.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Italy
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK to Be Marked in Italy
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- An Italian preparatory committee to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK was inaugurated in Rome on Aug. 23.
					 Flavio Pettinari, chief of the Italy-DPRK Friendship and Solidarity Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to widely introduce the exploits of peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and organize political and cultural events.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, August 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in booklet by the Santa Rita Publishing House of Ecuador on Aug. 21.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), deals with the idea that to preserve the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction is the basic principle to be maintained in carrying out the cause of socialism, and clarifies tasks and ways for doing so.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un ve la final de futbol de primera clase
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un ve la final de futbol de primera clase
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 28 en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la final de futbol (m) de primera clase por copa antorcha entre los once 25 de Abril del Ejercito Popular de Corea y Sonbong del Ejercito Rojo Obrero-Campesino.
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un la vio junto con Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kang Sok Ju, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ro Tu Chol, Jo Yon Jun, los miembros del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, los funcionarios directivos de las entidades patrocinadoras por disciplinas, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades de masas, el Consejo de Ministros, ministerios, organos centrales y de rama de deporte, deportistas, oficiales y soldados del EPC, jovenes y estudiantes en esta capital.
					
					El partido fue iniciado con el tiro de Sonbong.
					
					El primer tiempo termino con empate aunque los futbolistas de ambos equipos emprendieron la ofensiva.
					
					A eso de un minuto del segundo tiempo, la seleccion Sonbong marco un gol.
					
					Al cabo de la ofensiva furiosa, el equipo 25 de Abril marco un gol a eso de 20 minutos con cabezazo.
					
					A eso de 30 minutos, el jugador no.15 del Sonbong hizo chut en el punto de distancia 17 metros de la porteria, anotando otro gol.
					
					Pero, en el tiempo de arbitro, el equipo 25 de Abril desarrollo el ataque rapido, con lo cual recupero la nota perdida.
					
					Asi, el juego fue empatado y paso a un tiempo extra, lo que termino sin gol. 
					
					El penalti tambien termino con notas iguales y continuo el tiro hasta que la seleccion Sonbong vencio a su rival por 8:7.
					
					Terminado el juego, el Mariscal respondio a efusivas aclamaciones de los futbolistas y s espectadores. 
					
					El Mariscal llamo a los futbolistas y entrenadores del equipo vencedor, les felicito por exito de juego y tomo una foto de recuerdo junto con ellos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envio ofrenda floral ante difunto Kim Pyong Hun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envio ofrenda floral ante difunto Kim Pyong Hun
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 28 una ofrenda floral ante el difunto Kim Pyong Hun, Heroe del Trabajo y ex presidente de Comite Central de la Federacion General de Escritores y Artistas de Corea quien fue condecorado con la Orden Kim Il Sung y laureado con el Premio Kim Il Sung en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: CDN advierte a EE.UU. y Sur de Corea a actuar con prudencia
articles.content:
CDN advierte a EE.UU. y Sur de Corea a actuar con prudencia
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Departamento de Politica del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 29 la siguiente declaracion: 
					En estos dias, gracias a las medidas iniciativas de la RPDC en la Peninsula Coreana se alivia la coyuntura de tension y confrontacion y se crea un ambiente favorable a la reconciliacion y cooperacion en rumbo a lograr la paz y la estabilidad.
					
					Citamos por ejemplo los sinceros esfuerzos de la RPDC que puso en funcionamiento normal la Zona Industrial de Kaesong, que se encontraba en la crisis de cierre total, y resuelve con magnanimidad los problemas tales como el encuentro de familiares separados -simbolo tragico de la division nacional- y la reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Tanto en el tiempo pasado como en el presente, nuestro ejercito y pueblo mantienen la firme posicion y voluntad de realizar lo todo demandado por la epoca y deseado por la nacion. 
					
					Esta posicion y voluntad se basan en la ferrea decision politica de abrir el ancho camino de reunificacion de la patria, la paz y la prosperidad continuando perfectamente la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, programa de ejecucion de la primera. 
					
					Esos dos documentos devienen herencia patriotica por la reunificacion y noble fruto de los abnegados esfuerzos mentales y fisicos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Pero, desafortunadamente, el ambiente de reconciliacion, que se crea dificilmente, tropieza desde el principio con graves desafios debido al proceder injusto de EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas que no se liberan todavia del viejo concepto de enfrentamiento. 
					
					Los gobernantes actuales de EE.UU. y del Sur de Corea hablan por una parte de la preservacion de la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y de la creacion del ambiente de reconciliacion y confianza entre ambas partes coreanas, y por la otra, orquestan por si mismos la aventurera campana de guerra y los guiones de confrontacion. 
					
					Desde el pasado dia 19, al igual que en el pasado, despliegan los ejercicios belicos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" contra la RPDC describiendolos como entrenamiento "anual". Y desde mediados de agosto, se entregan publicamente al lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC movilizando a las escorias humanas. 
					
					No podemos menos que preguntarles de que apuntar el fusil a la contraparte del dialogo y responder a sus medidas magnanimas y pacificas con los ejercicios de guerra y la malsana campana intrigante psicologica es el "mejoramiento de relaciones" al estilo norteamericano y la "creacion de confianza" a la manera surcoreana. 
					
					Ya esta conocido por todos el que las autoridades de EE.UU. y del Sur de Corea insisten mas que nadie en la "renuncia nuclear" de la RPDC. 
					
					Sin embargo, ellas mismas recurren al abierto chantaje nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					Durante el presente simulacro, introducen sucesivamente en la Peninsula Coreana, sin distincion de las horas avanzadas de la noche ni del pleno dia, la escuadrilla de cazabombarderos estrategicos nucleares B-52H emplazados en la isla Guam, y el dia siguiente, mismas aeronaves en el territorio norteamericano. 
					
					Si desean de veras la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Corana, EE.UU. debe parar el chantaje nuclear contra la RPDC y tambien los actuales gobernantes surcoreanos deben abandonar la actitud dual de tolerar las armas nucleares de las fuerzas extranjeras y renegar las otras de la parte connacional. 
					
					Lo importante para evitar la repeticion del amargo lustro pasado de las relaciones intercoreanas es que las autoridades surcoreanas paren las conductas insultantes y limpien sus entranas de antipatia, odio, desconfianza y hostilidad. 
					
					Los gobernantes surcoreanos en actual mandato, que no tienen profunda comprension sobre la guerra ni los asuntos militares, toman la delantera en fomentar el enfrentamiento y agravar la tension dando vueltas incesantes a los puestos de mando de tiempo de guerra y los de campana.
					
					Los que actuan como ellos seran marginados de la corriente de la epoca y sufriran la vida corta vergonzosa. 
					
					El acto irreflexivo de elogiar un acuerdo de poca importancia logrado al cabo de muchos esfuerzos como "triunfo de principio" y el proceder de burlar la opinion publica con la pauta unilateral llamada "sentido comun y norma internacional" entenebrecera el ambiente de reconciliacion preparado dificilmente.
					
					El ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC no se rendiran ni retrocederan en preservar la paz y seguridad del pais y lograr la prosperidad nacional. 
					
					Por esta razon, nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias dotadas de invictos medios de ataque han observado con alta vigilancia teniendo al alcance de tiro, en reflejo de la aspiracion y demanda de la nacion, todo el proceso de los ejercicios de guerra de agresion  y todos los movimientos de la escuadrilla de cazabombarderos estrategicos nucleares. 
					
					Para la verdadera paz y el alivio de la tension de la Peninsula Coreana, revisamos con seriedad los asuntos para proyectar y ejecutar las constructivas y audaces medidas pacifistas manteniendo la maxima paciencia. 
					
					Ya llego el tiempo de poner punto final a la concepcion de hostilidad y la politica conflictiva, residuos de la guerra fria. 
					
					Ahora es el tiempo en que no se permiten los actos anacronicos contra la contraparte del dialogo, sino se necesita solo la decision politica util para crear el ambiente pacifico y de dialogo. 
					
					La epoca y la poblacion lo desean.
					
					EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas deben actuar con prudencia dandose clara cuenta de la tendencia de la epoca. 
					
					Deben tener presente que tienen limites la magnanimidad y la paciencia de la RPDC. 
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos observaran con alta vigilancia el movimiento de los gobernantes en actual mandato de EE.UU. y del Sur de Corea.

articles.title: Aprobado acuerdo sobre organizacion y operacion del Comite Conjunto Norte-Sur de ZIK
articles.content:
Aprobado acuerdo sobre organizacion y operacion del Comite Conjunto Norte-Sur de ZIK
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Norte y el Sur de Corea aprobaron el dia 28 el acuerdo sobre la organizacion y la operacion del Comite Conjunto Norte-Sur de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong (ZIK) como una medida practica para normalizarla segun el consenso.
					Ambas partes coreanas acordaron constituir el comite conjunto, una oficina permanente y subcomites necesarios adscritos al primero para consultar y solucionar los problemas que se presenten en la administracion de la ZIK.
					
					Decidieron efectuar el 2 de septiembre en la ZIK la primera reunion del Comite Conjunto del Norte y el Sur.

articles.title: Huespedes extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Huespedes extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- El enviado especial del gobierno chino encargado del problema de la Peninsula Coreana, Wu Dawei, y su comitiva asi como otros huespedes extranjeros visitaron el dia 29 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Ellos rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie y en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos.
					
					Pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes, el hall de llantos y las salas de conservacion de carros, tren electrico, barco y trenes usados por esos grandes hombres hasta el ultimo momento de su vida para las visitas de orientacion y viajes al extranjero.
					
					Y dejaron letras en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Acto de despedida a grupo de recorrido en moto Paektu-Halla de Nueva Zelanda
articles.content:
Acto de despedida a grupo de recorrido en moto Paektu-Halla de Nueva Zelanda
Pyongyang, 29 de agosto (ACNC) -- Paso por Kaesong el grupo de recorrido en motocicleta Paektu-Halla de Nueva Zelanda.
					Tuvo lugar el dia 29 el acto de despedida en Phanmunjom.
					
					Asistieron alli el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad  Corea-Nueva Zelanda, Pak Kyong Il y otros  funcionarios, ciudadanos de Kaesong y miembros del grupo de recorrido en motocicleta.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, el jefe del grupo dijo que el objetivo de la visita desde el monte Paektu hasta el Halla es demostrar a todo el mundo que Corea de larga historia es el territorio de mismo filon desde el monte Paektu hasta el Halla.
					
					Durante mi estancia en Corea, recibi profunda impresion por la hermosura de Corea y por el aspecto del pueblo coreano que hace ingentes esfuerzos por construir Estado prospero, apunto.
					
					Terminado el acto, los miembros del grupo partieron recibiendo calurosa despedida de los habitantes locales.
					
					Antes de partida, los huespedes recorrieron la lapida con firma del Presidente Kim Il Sung en Phanmunjom.
					
					Escuchando las explicaciones sobre el hecho de que el ejercito y pueblo coreanos lograron relevante victoria tras rechazar la invasion armada de las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas encabezadas por EE.UU., pasaron revista a los lugares de negociaciones de armisticio y de firma del Acuerdo de Armisticio y el Pabellon Phanmun.
					
					Ese dia, el grupo cruzo la linea de demarcacion militar.
